text:
Most Asian stocks climbed on growing optimism that U.S. legislators are on the brink of passing sweeping tax cuts. The Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of NSE Nifty 50 Index’s performance in India, rose 0.2 percent to 10,420.50 as of 6:40 a.m.Short on time? Well, then listen to this podcast for a quick summary of the article!











Day Break











Here’s a quick look at all that could influence equities on Tuesday.






Global Cues






The S&P 500 Index and Nasdaq Composite Index hit new highs Monday as investors focused on the progress of the proposed tax legislation.The House is scheduled to vote Tuesday on the tax bill following a floor debate that morning. It then goes to the Senate, where Republican leaders intend to bring it up as soon as they get it.Bitcoin is hovering above $18,000 after futures debuted Monday on the CME Group Inc.’s venue, the world’s biggest exchange, giving the cryptocurrency further cachet and access to mainstream investors.





‘Gujarat 2017 gives BJP and Congress the face saver they need’. #ElectionResult https://t.co/3GRMhUYI5W pic.twitter.com/fhRBnP4Il9— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) December 19, 2017






Europe Check






The Stoxx Europe 600 Index climbed the most in about five months as real estate, automakers and technology stocks led gains.Sterling advanced as U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May addressed parliament about her plans for Brexit.The euro strengthened after two days of declines.
















Asian Cues






Japan’s Topix Index was little changed, while the Nikkei 225 Stock Average edged up 0.2 percent.Futures on the S&P 500 Index were little changed.Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 Index was up 0.4 percent.Futures on Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index rallied 0.5 percent.Here are some of the key events scheduled for this week:The Reserve Bank of Australia’s December meeting minutes are due out, while Japan gives an update on November machine tool orders.






Commodity Cues






Brent crude ended higher at $63.41/barrel, up 0.3 percent.West Texas Intermediate crude was little changed at $57.32 a barrel.Gold was at $1,261.09 an ounce.Sugar snaps two-day losing streak; ended higher at 13.76 cents per pound; up 0.7 percent.Shanghai ExchangeSteel trades lower; down 0.3 percent.Aluminium trades flat.Zinc snaps six-day winning streak; down 0.2 percent.Copper trades higher for eight consecutive session; up 0.4 percent.Rubber snaps three-day winning streak; down 0.9 percent.






Indian ADRs
















Stocks To Watch






JM Financial approves raising Rs 650 crore via securities.De Nora secured an order worth Rs 12 crore from BHEL.LT Foods QIP opens with a floor price at Rs 79.13 per share.Bank of Baroda to consider raising additional funds on Dec. 22.Supreme Court rules in favour of Kamat Hotels as the prior user of the word “Orchid” in dispute with Orchid Hotels.Gandhi Special Tubes seeking shareholders’ approval to buyback 8.80 lakh shares at Rs 500 each.South Indian Bank sets one-year MCLR at 8.9 percent from Dec. 20.





Farm debt waivers announced by 5 states together are likely to widen the combined fiscal deficit of states by Rs 1.07 lakh crore or 0.65% of the GDP.https://t.co/ObntSPUkwM pic.twitter.com/a7usM4x0CE— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) December 18, 2017






Bulk Deals






Orchid Pharma: Serum Institute of India sold 7.50 lakh shares or 0.9 percent equity at Rs 18.55 each.Rama Steel Tubes: TCG Fund Fund bought 85,000 shares or 0.5 percent equity at Rs 195 each.Bharat Wire Ropes: Mentor Capital bought 2.89 lakh shares or 0.6 percent equity at Rs 114.78 each.Kridhan InfraGovt of Singapore bought 8.95 lakh shares or 1.2 percent equity at Rs 92 each.Mustray impex and services sold 20 lakh shares or 2.7 percent equity at Rs 92.21 each.Repro IndiaPromoter Abhinav Vohra sold 1.12 lakh shares or 1 percent equity at Rs 799 each.Sonam Parekh bought 1.12 lakh shares or 1 percent equity at Rs 799 each.Bharti AirtelSociete Generale bought 30 lakh shares or 0.1 percent equity at Rs 496.65 each.Morgan Stanley France SAS sold 30 lakh shares or 0.1 percent equity at Rs 496.65 each.ICICI BankSociete Generale bought 60 lakh shares or 0.1 percent equity at Rs 294.65 each.Morgan Stanley France SAS sold 60 lakh shares or 0.1 percent equity at Rs 294.65 each.Petronet LNGSociete Generale bought 50 lakh shares or 0.3 percent equity at Rs 245.65 each.Morgan Stanley France SAS sold 50 lakh shares or 0.3 percent equity at Rs 245.65 each.






Corporate Action






Archies circuit filter revised to 10 percent.Sree Leathers buyback worth Rs 32.9 crore begins today; circuit filter revised to 10 percent.Shalby added to S&P BSE IPO Index.






IPO Watch






Astron Paper & Board Mill IPO gets demand for 5.11 times shares offered on second day of sale, offer closes on Dec. 20





Why EESL is delaying its IPO, reports @anindya_u.https://t.co/zfVshbSJ4K— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) December 18, 2017






Who’s Meeting Whom?






Mahindra Finance to meet Motilal Oswal on Dec. 19.South Indian Bank to meet Kotak MF, LandT MF, ICICI Pru MF, GS, White Oak Cap on Dec. 19.Endurance Tech to meet ICICI Prudentital MF on Dec. 19.MCX to meet SBI Mutual Funds on Dec. 19.Blue Star to meet Franklin Templeton on Dec. 19.Eris life to meet Champlain Investment Partners and Mattews India Fund on Dec. 19.






Insider Trades






Omax Auto promoters sold 10,000 shares on Dec. 15.






Rupee






The home currency closed at 64.24 a dollar, down 0.28 percent from its Friday’s close of 64.05. The rupee opened at 64.23 a dollar and touched a high and a low of 64.09 and 64.72 respectively.






Top Gainers And Losers
















Index Trends
















F&O Cues






Nifty December Futures closed trade at 10404 with a premium of 15.6 points versus 26 points.December Futures: Nifty open interest down 1 percent; Bank Nifty open interest down 13 percent.India VIX down 12 percent at 13.1.Max open interest for December series at 10,500 Call (open interest at 72.4 lakh, down 2 percent).Max open interest for December series at 10,000 Put (open interest at 81.4 lakh, down 11 percent).





Income tax notices to be sent to high net-worth bitcoin traders.https://t.co/YOx6dwQKrV pic.twitter.com/HEazOpjmkn— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) December 18, 2017






F&O Ban






In Ban:FortisHDILJain IrrigationJP AssociatesJSW EnergyTV18 BroadcastWockhardtOnly intraday positions can be taken in stocks which are in F&O ban. In case of rollover of these intraday positions, there is a penalty.






Put-Call Ratio






Nifty PCR at 1.30 from 1.28.Nifty Bank PCR at 1.11 from 1.30.






Stocks Seeing High Open Interest Change

title: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Dec. 19
